name: SenseNet
tag_list: open-source, -net, content-management-systems, cms, portal-engine, website-builder, hybrid-open-source, hungary
overview:
Sense/Net develops open-source content management systems on the .NET platform. In October 2008, the company launched Sense/Net 6.0, the only enterprise-grade open-source portal builder available on .NET.

Sense/Net was founded in Hungary in 1995 with a vision to create friendly and accessible website-building tools for businesses. It also wanted to combine open-source technology with the .NET platform, in a movement that Sense/Net calls ‘hybrid open source’ â€“ providing an alternative to proprietary tools without abandoning .NET.

Sense/Net has dominated the Hungarian market for over 15 years, with clients including E.ON, Hungary’s National Bank and the Prime Minister’s Office. Its technology was also used to manage video content for the website of Hungaryâ€™s first reality show ‘The Bar’, as well as the Hungarian series of ‘Big Brother’.

Still based in Budapest, Sense/Net’s revenues now exceed â‚¬1 million and its staff has grown to over 40 people. The company is divided into two business units: one to deliver services to clients; and one to manufacture its solutions and supply them to resellers.
